definition: to rule/to govern/to manage/to control/to harness (a river)/to treat (a disease)/to wipe out (a pest)/to punish/to research

sentences.english: He also began to carry it out as soon as he took charge of FengXi warlord.
sentences.chinese: 在掌控奉系軍閥統治權後，他也開始踐行這一思想。

sentences.english: I assumed this gave me full reign over the clothes inside.
sentences.chinese: 我以爲這得以讓我享有對裏面衣服的絕對統治權。

sentences.english: And judgment shall sit, that his power may be taken away, and be broken in pieces, and perish even to the end.
sentences.chinese: 然後審判者要坐堂，奪去他的統治權，將他永遠消滅。

sentences.english: The essential of contradiction conflict is the dominion power of occupied region.
sentences.chinese: 這種矛盾衝突的實質是爭奪淪陷區的統治權。

sentences.english: As they contended for rule of the city, the factions became known as the tigers and elephants, respectively.
sentences.chinese: 當他們爭奪城市統治權時，兩派分別叫做虎黨與象黨。
